cat.lump.aq.textextraction.wikipedia.categories

Class DomainKeywords

  • java.lang.Object
    • cat.lump.aq.textextraction.wikipedia.categories.DomainKeywords

  • public class DomainKeywords
extends java.lang.Object

    This class gets the most common terms in the articles belonging to, at least, one category of a given domain. A domain is defined by one category (root) and all of its subcategories.

    Terms are stemmed and stopwords are not included.

    TODO UNITTEST!!!

    jboldoba

      • loadArticles

        public void loadArticles(int categoryID)
                  throws WikiApiException
        Loads the articles of the given category ID.
        Parameters:
        categoryID - Identifier of the category. The category must exist in the Wikipedia database
        Throws:
        WikiApiException - Raised if creating a Wikipedia connector is not possible for the given language and year.

      • loadArticles

        public void loadArticles(java.lang.String categoryName)
                  throws WikiApiException
        Loads the articles of the given category. The category is defined by its name.
        Parameters:
        categoryName - Name of the category
        Throws:
        WikiApiException - Raised if creating a Wikipedia connector is not possible for the given language and year or if the category name is not valid in that Wikipedia connector

      • toFile

        public void toFile(java.io.File file)
        Saves the top list of a text file. The resulting file contains one tab-separated term per line with frequency and term.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to save the list into.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method. It can be used as tool to obtain a domain list of terms. This program writes a file in the user working directory with the terms sorted by their frequency in descending order. The file is called "categoryID_language.dict"
        Parameters:
        args - List of parameters:
        • Language: Language of the Wikipedia
        • Year: Year of the Wikipedia
        • Category: ID of the category which defines the domain
        • Top: Desired percentage of the dictionary, e.g. top=10 implies write the 10% of the dictionary with the highest frequencies.
